0pFiLSsavcu1w6w02tltmQ.text: Stood by the hostess stand for 15 min and was never greeted. A line of hungry patrons started to build up behind us. Finally acknowledged by a very stressed woman. No friendliness to her. Just looked at us and said it's an hour wait. Looked around restaurant- lots of empty tables and dirty tables. Thought ok maybe they don't have staff. Asked if we could eat at bar and was told we were still going to wait an hour because kitchen it backed up. Just really rude and disorganized. I've been to the one in Phoenix and it has a different feel that I loved.  This feels very corporate.

mizc3MGkFxMHzp3yUAGNuA.text: Love Lo-Lo's! It's such a fun and funky place to eat. Our kids always have such a blast giggling at the menu names and ordering different color Kool-Aids. We originally tried the location in Arizona while on vacation and loved it so when we saw there was one here in Vegas we had to check it out. We always have great service every time we go, the servers are always friendly and upbeat. The food is always delicious. My favorite is the Stupid Fries! They are absolutely to die for. Whatever sauce they use as gravy is SO good! Now don't get me wrong, this definitely isn't our nightly or even weekly dinner spot, we'd probably be battling high cholesterol and obesity if we did but it's definitely a treat every once in a while. I highly recommend this place, maybe as your "cheat" day spot.

GWYfY-vRpid02KwVvchQEQ.text: Came here for New Year's Eve my step sister informed me about this place. It's located in a shopping center so there's more than enough parking space. The customer service is good they gave me a southern hospitality feel. They were playing 90's music that day so I was singing the whole time I was there lol. Now the food it's served in good size portions and has good flavor. There drinks are served in big mason jars. I'd definitely come back. Didn't give it five stars cause the booth needed the be wiped down there was syrup on the seat & table

v_LEFgpks-EItr52yjsbJA.text: I came here the first Sunday after they opened.  That being said it was obviously crowded, and I knew there was going to be a wait because friends had gone the night before so I went in with patience.  There was five of us total.  We arrived around 1 o'clock and were lucky enough to find seating at the bar.  They don't have their liquor license yet so between us ice tea and diet soda was ordered. We did have the option to eat at the bar but we preferred waiting for a table.  After about an hour we checked to see where our name was on the list and apparently it had been called and we missed it.  Considering how crowded it was and the noise level the hostess needs to make a better effort of calling out names or getting some sort of mic system.  We had just missed it so they sat us next.  This was about 2 o'clock.  Our waitress told us that due to the crowds the wait time from ordering our food to receiving it  would be about 30-35 minutes.  We all ordered immediately since we had an hour at the bar to watch plates come out and peruse the menu.  An hour passed and our food came out.  My table mates were getting a little ancy at this point.    I ordered the KK's.  Three pieces of chicken, two waffles, two eggs and grits.  The chicken is fried to perfection but also perfectly juicy.  I ordered it with breast, thigh, and wing, but it came with two wings, so not sure if I got lucky or if that's the way it comes out.  Can't go wrong with scrambled eggs with cheese and onions.  The grits were a little watery but not a deal breaker.  The waffles had a cinnamon flavor to them that I also enjoyed.  Someone else at the table commented that they would have preferred more crisp waffles but I think that's a personal preference.  Previous to that I had sampled the fried green tomatoes ordered for the table with a honey mustard type of dip.  Those I would order a again for sure.  The portions are very generous so next time I might change my chicken selection or get a to-go box as I did this time.    Service was attentive and we learned a little bit about the history of LoLo's.  Because of the wait one of my table mates did ask to speak to a manager and a more than fair discount was given so props to management for being so apologetic about the wait even though it was to be expected.  I will definitely be returning after a few weeks when the crowds die down but most likely not on a Sunday because that appears to be a just out of church crowd which probably even once it dies down those larger parties will continue to flock there on Sundays.

uoFVOvXDMpUPfAieWG__2Q.text: My experience was great. We were greeted and sat as soon as we walked in. Our server, Kiki, was sweet and attentive. The food was good, came out quickly, and was hot! We didn't have any issues and I would definitely come back.  I got the #1 (KK's). The eggs were some of the best that I've ever had. The portions were really huge! We were able to take leftovers :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. KK&#39;s Breakfast

4frr-j9We3KQCG5vNfIwqg.text: Was only there once and only had the gangster fries. They are amazing! Their hot sauce is delicious!  Beer is cold and service is friendly. Can't wait to try more menu items.

bS3rbPfRBFmbH_cK4uxTeA.text: As usual... excellent service and good plentiful food too... Rye did her thang with us tonight and I'm very happy with the results of her service at our table... We will be back!

4Ot4KfmLtuRQdq3vfBsAJw.text: GREAT FOOD, GREAT DRINKS, staff isn't pushy.  Everything is well seasoned and well cooked.  Non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks are large and delicious!  LOVE coming here for a filling and satisfying meal! Can't wait to return!!!

KlbtijcMelGoYX_8f2ILHQ.text: Please get some more wait staff . The bartender can't service the bar and 5 tables . I placed an hour and left after 30 minutes - no water served while I waited . I left because there were 4 people that were there before me and none had their food yet . I've eaten here before and the food was delicious but your lack of attention to good service will turn many people away. It's a Monday afternoon .

pyjKTc900Vq7BV0cP3BawA.text: In Vegas to attend the Vegas Invitational High School Basketball Tournament at Mountain-view Christian School. This place was recommended by a friend.  Saturday afternoon around 2:30 pm we walked in, there was no wait.  My father saw this guy wearing the restaurants t-shirt and mentioned that the guy looked like a famous basketball player.  My son and husband both said, "Kevin Johnson of the Phoenix Suns." I looked and said, "That's Kevin Johnson the Mayor of Sacramento."   My dad called him over and asked him if he was Kevin Johnson and he said, "Yes." He said he'd just opened up the restaurant.  A little while later my dad called him over again and told Mr. Johnson that my son had just competed in a basketball tournament here and if he could give him some pointers.  He gave him some GREAT pointers on how to be a better guard.    Our server, Bree (Lead Server), knew the True meaning of "Customer Service!"  She was patient & attentive.  The other server were attentive too.  Even though it wasn't their table, they came by to refill my son's BIG OLE MASON JAR of Tropical Punch KOOL AID.    We started with appetizers, Fried Chicken Gizzards and Fries String Bean.  They were the BOMB. The dipping sauce that came with it was very flavorful.  We all had Fried Chicken and/or Fried Cat Fish.  They had a wide variety of sides.  I had fried Okra and Dirty Rice.  We ALL had to take doggies bags.  To eat on our flight back to LA.  If you get the chance to go to there you won't be disappointed.  Thanks Kevin and Bree!

wTBQmIuraMxBcQMtt0doOA.text: So it's been a loooooong azz wait.  Its busy but damn.  The chicken was seasoned well.  the fish was bland but  good.    Overall, the meals was still very good and probably worth the wait. KJ, the staff needs to become more efficient in providing quicker service.   Waitress were very nice.  I will come back.  Three star for me.  Just for the long azz wait

gc8IZMN4cbMc8hIilG1UCQ.text: Just look at the size of this chicken leg! More like a chicken wing. After waiting for so long, this was served to us. Waste of time & waste of money. Chicken had no flavor, waffles were bland. First time coming, and it'll be the last.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What kind of chicken is this? More like a chicken wing!

Eg3XWxCm7Mdtg9Myy9HVnQ.text: Oh my gosh, I've never been to a restaurant that serves Kool-Aid! How amazing it was to wash down my food with sweet, ice cold Tropical Punch Kool-Aid served in a large hip mason jar.   Being from California, I think my boyfriend and I were comparing Lo-Lo's to Roscoe's a little too hard. Oops. However, I did find the chicken was sooo juicy. The chicken's breading was crunchy but it was ok-tasting, nothing too special. The eggs, onions, and cheese were alright. They weren't as airy/fluffy as I'm used to. I enjoyed how thick the waffles were. The next time I visit, I would ask for the waffles to be cooked a little longer for that crunch since they were on the softer side. All together, I especially enjoyed Lolo's affordable pricing for the amount of food you'll receive!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ugm42CujiM7cHFhpkKwkEA.text: Every time I come to Vegas I have to make a stop here. The server Jazzie Jaz service is great and foos was delicious as always

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. JazzieJazz, ahe makes you feel like family service and food was great

YAAdoDC9okANNFIT0TRrhg.text: I ordered the LoLos which is 3 pieces of chicken and 2 waffles. The chicken was good and the waffles were made nicely. Only thing I would suggest is having different types of syrup because the syrup was a little bland and they could have options for other flavors or sweetness.   My friend from out of town and I came here last night in hopes of meeting one of my favorite players growing up, the great Kevin Johnson. To our surprise he was the one that greeted us and sat us down to our table! He was very nice and patient with us. He's a very hands-on owner and you can see why he was a 2 term mayor of Sacramento.  He's not the only celebrity in the house. I recognized his brother-in-law who is a Korean-English interpreter for MMA/UFC Korean fighters. KJ's wife is also an author and was on the cover of Newsweek for Education Advocacy.   I will definitely be coming here again for the great experience and the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j_-IBUrPVki-pZMfxTtclw.text: My family gave this place a try for the first time recently. It was Sunday brunch so there was a bit of a wait and quite a long wait for our food. Boy was it worth it. I've never had such tender chicken and the biscuit and gravy was absolutely delicious. My husband said he would have gladly eaten the gravy on its own. Service could have been better as our server wasn't very attentive. The food will definitely bring us back though.

0E_MDmBFM37fG3BvZ8DzEA.text: Decent food,nice atmosphere...the drink waiter was funny,the regular waiter was dry and seemed to hate her job...Everyone loved the shrimp macaroni n cheese,my sis said that it was "orgasmic" I had the catfish which was perfectly crispy,but lacking any flavor. The waffles were soft and tasted like "diet waffle" you know...with the healthy flour,not regular white flour.So,even after we took the waffles home to crisp them,they were still not good..I don't want whole wheat millet waffles...chicken was ok.Grits were perfection.Kool-aid was literally on tap,lol....

ZomLJSSTL3fyT_zYzULqrA.text: My love wanted to bring me here for lunch one Saturday,  and OMG.....This was absolutely the very best fried chicken and waffle and sweet tea that I have ever had in my life!!!! I would definitely come back here again to the Las Vegas location.  Everything was great for my first experience here.  We had a great waitress (JAZZY) the DJ was great,  the atmosphere & vibe was phenomenal for a Saturday evening lunch!!! The food.....bomb.com!!! I counted at least 12 tables empty people are waiting and they say it will be 45 min to 1 hr. I would say this is the poorest ran establishment I have seen! My last trip there!

kplaPkoZmenE-zMbO4NxPw.text: I had chicken and waffles and  they were delicious.  Sunday morning they play gospel music...  Church & breakfast at the same time.. The service was good however they don't need to continue to keep bugging you... A little too much. $3 mimosas were great to.

Q6pOPmfj1k_2_hrEBJJAzg.text: I never understood what Southern Comfort was until I came to Lolo's. As soon as you walk inside a has such a cool rustic Southern theme to it. My favorite is all the roosters around the restaurant and they're nice lighting. Even the music they play has some soul! Every time we go we were seated immediately. They give us menus for our kids to keep them entertained with crayons! The staff is great at checking on you during meal. And they also help answer questions mainly because I was never really familiar with a lot of stuff on the menu. Their portions are soo big. The lemonade and sweet tea are delicious. I've actually mix them myself and I've made my own Arnold Palmer but you can always ask for your own when ordering. I love their menu because we have so many options with chicken and waffle. You can get a breast, drumstick or thighs. My favorite is a chicken breast with a waffle and I also love their gravy and biscuits. The perfect time to come here if as soon as they open mainly because later in the day it gets packed. Especially on a Sunday. This last time we went we had a hard time getting the server's attention. We even sat next to the servers area where they put in the checks. Nobody gave us crayons this time or waters even straws were forgotten when they delivered our drinks. I had to go up and ask. Maybe it was a busy day but ill still some back

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge mason jars for sweet tea and lemonade
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best part of the menu

FsJUZVsfRhjaZW2uhyZyRQ.text: The biscuits and gravy really hit the spot. Plenty of gravy. The biscuits are the best I've had in town. Fluffy and soft. The gravy was rich with good flavor not greasy tasting. It has tons of sausage and is a little spicy. Eggs were over easy without the whites being runny, which seems to be difficult to get at restaurants. Potatoes could have been cooked longer. They were too firm, but still edible. The Fried chicken was crispy while still remaining moist inside.  The greens had a smokey sweet flavor to it. No bitterness. Cornbread muffin was moist. We arrived early dinner time so had no wait and parking was easy. Our server was Nae and had a bubbly personality. She and other servers made sure to check on us regularly. Overall, very satisfied. Felt we got our money's worth. Would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Momma&#39;s biscuits and gravy, eggs over easy and potatoes
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The soul food platter. Southern Fried chicken, Greens, dirty rice and corn bread muffin

DTPNtguv_swwhtd2Eow8yA.text: This was my first time here and I absolutely LOVED it! The food was SO delicious and the service wa great. The food was homemade style and tasted the way our grandmother cooked. The staff were polite and so accommodating. They seated over 60 of us. Dee the manager was super sweet and went above and beyond for us. She and her team assisted in giving us the greatest dining experience we've ever had while traveling with our basketball team. They even kept the restaurant open an hour past closing time AND played our favorite songs which we all started dancing to. Love, love, loved this place! Thank you Lolo's for an unforgettable night

BnKwFc8Oz3ONhrD1M6fhcA.text: The food is amazing.    Don't bring a large group.   We have attempted to have two birthday parties at Lo-Lo's because we love the food, once in October of last year and again in February.  Both times the orders were a mess. A few appetizers came after the meal and the waiter didn't understand why we didn't want them.  They attempted to split our groups and as a result one half of the party got their food in a timely fashion but the food was all cold before the rest of the party got served.  We never got refills or condiments that we requested.  If it's dinner for two, they will do great.

RfSblNRybXlSbQlO-RuGOg.text: Food was great and the customer service was equally stellar. Our server Marcus was very pleasant and attentive and we even met the owner, KJ Johnson who was assisting patrons as well. Will most definitely return on my next trip to Vegas.

yhoP0CyHwEnb11g_ZfMyDA.text: I don't know where to start... this place is amazing! Everything from the decor to the food was top notch.   I ordered the 2pc chicken and one waffle with a side of red beans. The beans were ok, but they don't have a smoke flavor if that's what you are looking for. The chicken was well seasoned, crispy and the waffle was fluffy with a hint of cinnamon.  All and all, very good meal, and I'll be coming back whenever I get another cheat meal on my diet!

nxb_H-lJM6oMkzwkBEbBPA.text: I found this place while searching for a breakfast/brunch sit down and dined in on 3/28. I like to be fair when posting a rating and review. I would've loved to give Lo-Lo's 5 stars but here's why I didn't. To start, the host never acknowledge anyone as they entered and was very dry. Secondly, although the chicken was fried well, it tasted as though the oil was old.  On to the pluses! The waitress was good and continuously checked on us throughout our dining experience. Unfortunately, she didn't have a name tag on so I can't give her (Caucasian Female) a direct s/o. The portions were side and fit the prices. Besides the chicken tasting like it was fried in old oil, everything else tasted delish. The waffles are far better than Roscoe's, hands down. I give Lo-Lo's 2 's Up and looking forward to visiting again, when I'm back in town.

EZlH_760nzC5WDmEgKoAvg.text: If I could not have given any stars I would 1st problem my party had a 30-45 min wait with mulitple tables and booth open 2nd problem I asked the host Daphne  if my party could sit at a booth instead of the table of her choice she told me I would have to wait another 30-45min to sit at a booth and clearly there was 2 booths available I was applaud when she sat another party who was on the waiting list in the booth I had ask for 3rd problem I ordered a drink and changed my mind my waitress said she could not take it off but yet I had to wait 30min for my drink despite my drink Bree was awesome she deserve the stars  I don't think I will be ever returning its sad when you try to support our black establishment and end up disappointed 5 thumbs down !!!!! B

VS0M0R3EexOFr3oqclYhVg.text: I called in to place an order for pick up today, a guy answered and say can you hold please, he never came back. I wash my hands grab my car keys drive there still on hold to get there 17 minutes later I show the host my phone that I been on hold. He goes to the bar and talks to the bar maid they laugh and he tells me I can order at the bar.  I changed my mind wanting something to eat there, I just orded my attorney food and left.

ITJrCFsxrvRIh1aXBrIuLA.text: Best chicken and waffles we have tried lately ... Mr johnson was there at the moment and gave us the best hosting service very humble person .waitress was fabulous and food was on point chicken was juicy only thing i would compain are just the drinks their too sweet but nothing you cant fix with a glass of water other then that its great .very nice and spacious place to enjoy a meal looking forward to go every time i go to vegas

Kwbt0EmKxPW_D3Mp1yxuMw.text: I really wanted to like LoLo's but they just won't let me. It was my second time visiting and it just wasn't worth me trying it again. The atmosphere is dull and boring, the waiters/waitresses have no urgency to serve you, and they have no enthusiasm. I ordered the Catfish, mac and cheese and the string beans. The catfish wasn't cooked all the way through it was under cooked..very soft when I bit into it. The mac and cheese was just ok but the string beans were actually pretty good. Very flavorful. The music played in the restaurant was way to loud and the bar was CLOSED so I couldn't order a cocktail which was very disappointing. And it was very early in the evening. I won't be visiting LoLo's again.

vx7FHgn9pelfg9n8jF5Zhg.text: I think I found a new go to spot in Vegas. I've read some of the other reviews and have to agree that this is a hidden gem. This is worth a short drive from the strip if you want good service and delicious food. The choices are awesome. The drinks are also delicious.  The prices are reasonable..and the service is great. Star is such a sweetheart. Must get the waffles and mac and cheese. The chicken is seasoned well. The drinks are fun and tasty. The Lolo punch and the green apple koolaid are winners! I have no complaints.

dUS4AYF5wPYm0Z-du41XKA.text: Visiting from California 818 to be exact everything was absolutely delicious we had the pleasure of being hosted by Jazzy Jazz who exceeded her customer service skills very attentive and such a sweetheart made our first experience just PERFECT!

XM_3P5x7p8Tst5pEt08ahA.text: Food is delicious, so is the lemonade. Customer Service from the older staff is what ruins the experience... talk about judgmental & ill mannered etiquette in-front of customers!

IYiPrtPQxub_ABhaQl0qWw.text: Love me some chicken and waffles. We had the #9) leg  theigh and waffle and the #10) two legs and waffle. Both $7 each so a good value here. Excellent hot crispy chicken, not a drop of grease, tender and juicy on the inside. Waffles are of course southern not fluffy Belgian style. I like to add a little bit of hot sauce which gives it all a good kick in combination with the sweetness of the  maple syrup. Now looking over the menu there are some great value items here and not on others. Its a bit confusing as you look at the combinations of items wondering how they came up with prices based on them, so spend some extra time looking over the menu. Portions are generous and I left feeling full and satisfied without breaking the bank. Lo Lo's is a perfect addition to the area.

ngHPeUwqaKV-dCRRHvYswg.text: The chicken was awesome and so was the mac & cheese. The menu was huge with all day breakfast and all kinds of variety. Our server Shawntavia was great- super friendly and nice. We can't wait to go back and bring our friends.

tJQ7Ru7WA_c0qcY2o0QX0A.text: This restaurant just opened a few weeks ago and when we tried to get in the first time there was an hour wait.  When we went Saturday there was a long wait also but we sat in the bar area (everyone in the party needs to be over 21).  The menu is extensive but being our first time we had to try the Lo-Lo chicken dinner which consists of your choice of an three pieces of chicken (but not more than one breast) and a waffle.  We did wait a long time but our waitress was attentive bringing drink refills while we waited.  When our meals came out they were hot and vey tasty.  The chicken was crispy and delicious but the waffles could have been cooked more.  We all thought they were not done enough.  I will definitely go back but next time I would order the chicken with another side.  They had choices of beans and rice, grits, french fries.

PMzQ0M3dHoJH2_mBEy0rAQ.text: Food is good however the lack of customer service was terrible. We waited forever to be greeted, served a drink and to get someone to take our order. Remind you we sat in the bar. The bartender was no where to be found. She came 20- 30 min later asking if she could help...Um no! The restaurant was NOT pack at all so there was no excuse. The serving staff and bartender needs to take advice and learn from their Phoenix location. Good food doesn't makeup for lack of customer service.

1EXrB7uofUDvdFAELyw3YQ.text: Food was great. The service was even better. And the playlist of music was banging!!! Such a great friendly environment

Ki1MfCiwAyu5bL0UHU6zNA.text: I'm so disappointed, I've been here for 30 minutes at the bar.  No one has taken my order except one girl that says she will take my order but she doesn't really know how to do it!  She says everyone here is new and nobody really knows what they are doing!  This restaurant has been in business way too long for this type of customer service.  I will never come back here again!

n6FEp6wn5wi157vrPTOZRQ.text: Went to Lo Lo's Chicken and Waffle the day after Thanksgiving. I was in town visiting family. I am told there is usually a long wait to get in. Due to the holidays there was no line.  We made reservation in advance we we arrived our table was ready. The seating host was very nice and accommodating to our party. We were then created by the friendliest and most helpful waitress. She worked really hard. We placed our orders for the food and waited about 30 min for our food to be served.  Meanwhile we had a few drinks off the menu entitled (dranks) it was kool aide with a kick. The drinks were surprisingly delicious. The food was plentiful I had the fried chicken wings, greens, yams, and macaroni and cheese. I really enjoyed the meal.  The greens were seasoned to perfection. I am not a fan of sweet cornbread but it was served warm with butter for those who like cornbread that taste like cake.  One of the other highlights of the meal was the smothered chicken and waffles. Someone else at our table ordered it and said it was delicious. So if you are ever in vegas staying on the strip it would be worth it to catch an uber to Lo Lo's for some good tasting soul food.

Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smothered country fried steak and greens

nKKuVoMP8BULxxlquNocfw.text: I highly recommend them! Great food and the price is right. They have the right size dish for everyone, HUGE or small dishes. The staff is friendly, and the restaurant is laid back and casual. They have a fun theme, and drinks that fit the theme of the restaurant. Give them a try!

_87LDo6ff9jANRax-aZn6w.text: We were extremely excited to try this place and had heard great things from a friend. We took my husbands parents and were extremely disappointed. We arrived around 1200pm on a Sunday and the wait time was about 20 mins which was not bad. After getting our seats it took a server over 20 mins to take our drink order or to even acknowledge us. Afterwards we were ignored.  The time that it took to take our order was ridiculous.  Then after almost 2 hours of waiting on our food to arrive  I finally asked to speak to a manager, Nate, and within minutes our food arrived. He apologized and said he would offer us a discount.  The food itself was was wonderful. If we had not been so excited to catch up with my husbands parents we would have left. I dont know if it was a racial thing as we are a white family but every other black family was served and taken care of before us. The discount that Nate promised never happened instead he comp a drink. Needless to say, food was great, service was horrible.

Dc5uiTfiHpZMSyXOjj_qGw.text: This is a great place for southern fried cooking. Probably the best fried green tomatoes I've had and the chicken tenders and waffles were wonderful also. Nice atmosphere but the music was a little loud.

vohCOiFD9dOPHlCdyzNc9Q.text: Unfortunately arrived here after a Friends recommendation and it was closed despite yelp saying it closed at 10pm...its 7pm Sunday... Maybe I'll try next time we come to LV

RCoiPu78BE4bKB_JTl3OQA.text: Came here last night the food was good we had the fried green beans, cat fish beinget's, and the tenders and waffles I would have gave it more stars but the service was slow waited 15 minutes for water and extra plates had to actually ask twice and when they offered to remake the waffles it took almost a half hour! Working in the restaurant industry as a sous chef that is just unacceptable!! Overall the food and flavors were pretty good will be back again to give it another try.

48hfqW_hoxBkK0nPR8FS5A.text: My cousin and I had lunch today. We had the most wonderful, professional server named Sparky. Sparky was friendly, patient, and very knowledgable of the menu. I had the 3 piece chicken in smothered gravy, Mac and cheese, and rice and gravy, needless to say; I won't be cooking dinner! Donna Jean had the 2piece chicken and waffles, and we share dessert, banana pudding! This is my fifth time at Lo lo and every time has been exceptional. I highly recommend.

oHYF2BKM6os55LT00wjjTg.text: Waitress was very nice and catering. However the greens was mushy as if it had been re-warmed to many times. The chicken was very bland and lacked seasoning. The Mac n cheese pic you see on menu and the one you get is two different things . It tasted like they used velveeta nacho cheese on it. I was expecting oven baked Mac due to pic advertised on menu. Maybe they was lazy that day.The catfish was the best thing on the menu but nothing to drive out your way for. I'd rather go to grits cafe. However if your looking for a good drink they do make great cocktails . This place is over rated and lacked season and real southern passion behind the food.

3r8tIPicwcD3uKYzcguJ3A.text: Went here a cpl weeks ago with my co worker. We love roscoes so were excited to hear of a similar place out here in Vegas...the drinks and chicken were good but the waffles not so much. They were cinnamony and dry then when syrup was added they got super soggy and shredded apart. Maybe it was just a bad batch they were super busy so maybe the chef was rushed. But I still plan on going back to try more dishes! Tip for all u, call and reserve a spot ahead of time!! Especially if its for more than 4 people. We waited for 2 hrs for 7 of us.

BQyAaugUuu7bi_GylLz2cQ.text: First time here. We had a party of 6 and ended up waiting 45 minutes for our food to come out. Our waitress was great and kept checking in on us. She provided some cornbread and refilled a couple of drinks we had that were not normally refillable. When the food finally came out it look great I had chicken and waffles with side of grits and a scrambled egg with cheese and onion. The chicken was the best xhocken I had tasted in Vegas and the waffle was cooked perfectly. The eggs were food but I didnt get to eat the grits because I was full off the other stuff. Without the long wait Inwould have given it 4 stars but the manager did comp part of our bill because of the wait. I will be back again because of the great staff.

l4mOun0jFywmQiW34-fbVw.text: The food is good and they serve big portions! Chicken is very flavorful. I didn't give it a 5 because of the bad service. Took 10 minutes for a server to even stop by our table to take our drink order.

ga_A_oFFCjEVXLAo3I1iVw.text: Everything on the menu is great, the Koolaid and Iced Tea is the best, very large portions, the only reason i give them 4 stars is because it always takes long to get your order, that could be because they are always busy or because they want to make sure it is right, always worth the wait though.

b2Lv0nyOF8PvuRPJuI5OCA.text: Best chicken and waffles I have ever had. Service was great. Very friendly staff. My only complaint was the fried okra was a little under cooked. Can't wait to go back.

0PElFyKcz07C381iD2hxww.text: Never going back.   Went weekday at 10:45 am and it took 10 minutes before a server showed up.   IT WAS NOT BUSY.  Requested a pitcher of Blue Moon Beer and waited.   And waited.  And Waited.   Finally, I went to the bar and asked the server for a pitcher; the waiter did not know how to "ring one up"   So he just ignored us.   So we waited another 5 minutes for the server to talk to a manager-type person.   There was some discussion, but still no drinks.   There were 6 people talking outside, a cashier AND a Hostess, but no one would wait on us.   After a few more minutes, the waiter  said this bar only had one pitcher.   We almost finished the pitcher and we were ready to order, but again, no server with 6 people milling outside and two more by the cash register.   I had to ask one of the girls at the register to get us a server.  She went outside where there a lot of people and the server came.    It only got worse; the server offered no condiments, there was only one pitcher in this restaurant, and he had to take the empty one and wash it and refill it.   Then I had to request fresh, iced glasses that come with a pitcher.   We got some apologies after shortcomings were pointed out, but that server and all the folks on that day shift need training.    I personally spent many years waitressing so I know what good service is and what bad service is.    We had been on errands and I was thirsty before we got there.    Never again

aypryyYk3H25cAXVVrPAsw.text: I love this restraunt the food is fabulous and really good and the place is really clean the server that I had is a man named Sparky he was so kind and funny he was cracking jokes with me

dfmwsP9UqQGsTwhrmn-m5Q.text: Mediocre soggy waffles that came to the table lukewarm and had to be sent back...nothing special about the chicken.  Spent the next hour throwing it up and letting it out bcuz it made us sick.  Try to season the chicken with more than lawry's to give it more flavor and add a touch of malt flour and perhps cinnamon to the waffle batter. Also, when serving 2 waffles, have it brought to the table quickly so that it stays crispy.  Overall, this restaurant was average at best

CH2lliKI38O41k7d-mzJwA.text: Great food good service I love this place . The portions are very generous . Prices are great .

nXAWD1nJPEPYMKaGmU0QLg.text: It was ok! I just wouldn't pay $3 for a cup of Kool aid when it's .25 cent a pack at the grocery store.  The service I received was really good. I like the waffles too.

MXYlGD1g43qadhPwMeHydA.text: So I am not sure what was more pleasing the service or the food. ut9t11vs0iPs9KGUW_n5AA.text: Tried this place on two occasions. Still waiting on the liquor license is what the staff continues to say. Fried chicken is pretty good. Sadly the waffles are dense and not very good. They come two ways soggy or hard as a rock. Catfish batter is too thick. Greens are delicious! P_3w_y96ppQrPxLRuOseKw.text: Decent food tried thee shrimp n grits corn fritters mac n cheese n chicken n waffles... Service was good. They were out of the kool aid when i went unfortunately. But i will say the shrimp n grits were one of the best I've had outside of my own. Mac n cheese had  good flavor , waffles were soft like stated in another review like a pancake i would prefer mine to have a slight crisp so may wanna ask to cook alil longer if this is u. My chicken wing was excessively cooked but still decent  . Will give another try n would recommend

Mo4TZGZbTzOSn2SIqbd4uA.text: Juicy chicken but their waffles weren't that good. I would recommend getting one where a side is included like Mac and cheese.

nCaodcDO7pcTL2zskQ-v9Q.text: The food was great. The atmosphere was comfortable.  We had no problem with the wait times. But then again, I will wait for good food. The shrimp Mac and cheese is delicious! Huge serving.  The fried chicken is crispy and juicy. Overall very happy with meal.

wrqwki58EKSICHnDm4CX0A.text: I am use to dining at Lo Los in Scottsdale-Phoenix, AZ when I resided out there and was very excited to hear they were opening here in Las Vegas. I wend during the first week of opening and it was very busy. Wait times exceeded 2 hours for a booth but seated immediately for the bar. Food was mediocre and there was a limited menu due to a 'soft open' which disappointed me since I have a favorite meal I typically get that was not available. Once I ordered, my friend and I's food took over 45 minutes to come as well as when we were finished we sat for an additional 45 minutes waiting to get the check. I would give this place another go since I did go the first week but first impression was meh.

1GrLi2UPa2BXS0fX9fRNug.text: We ate at Lo-Lo's today and had an excellent experience! We ordered Pineapple Upside Down pancakes to share along with our eggs, meat and grits. While we were waiting for our food, the manager came out and apologized, saying the griddle stopped working and they would not be able to make our pancakes. We asked if he could make the recipe into waffles! He said YES and that our other food would come out while the waffles were being made. And he said the waffles would be no charge due to the inconvenience! The manager made the waffles as we requested and served them himself to us! AND the Pineapple Upside Down waffles were scrumptious!!!! The manager came back out to see if we liked them and we told him he should make that a menu item! In addition, the service was excellent and everyone was very friendly and courteous. This dining experience was truly pleasurable for this senior couple. Our thanks to Lo-Lo's! We truly appreciated our time with you today!

HpLrmC-xAaWVfZCA8iFBpQ.text: Worst experience.   My daughter recommended Lolos Chicken and Waffle so on Friday 04/06/18 around 7pm we arrived and it was 2 adults and 3 kids.  The hostess was acting as a hostess/busser.  Then it took 20 minutes for someone to come to the table and ask us what we would like.  Since we had some time we decided to order an appetizer and order our food at the same time.   Appetizer came out fine however, our food was another story.  It took over an hour for the dinner to arrive.   While waiting I took my 2 granddaughters to the restroom and when I came back my daughter said they came and packed the leftover appetizer and were ready to give her the check.   She is like wait a minute we haven't received our food. And the waitress seemed confused.  Mind you we ordered Mac and cheese. Grilled cheese fried fish pancakes and biscuits and gravy. Simple meal.  Then an another lady came out and brought our food and we asked if they forgot our order and she did not apologize or seem to care.       I paid for the full meal.  Would I recommend this restaurant to family friends and coworkers.    No, I would not!!!   25 years of the restaurant and hospitality business.     It seemed like everyone there were all over the place with no direction.

CZpSxyWk34HJGotyKwL9AQ.text: When I first tried Lo-lo's I was blown away. I was ecstatic knowing I wouldn't have to drive down to Los Angeles for Roscoe's chicken anymore. Lo-Lo's chicken is juicy, cooked to perfection. Their corn bread muffin is to die for. However, went back for the second time - the chicken was still good, the corn bread muffin a bit dryer than the first time and the SERVICE, oh soooo bad. Sat for 15 mins still with no one coming up to even take our drink orders. We finally flagged down this kind waitress who insisted to take out orders even though it wasn't her area. The waitress in our area finally came and things got a bit worst. One thing for sure, when you want Lo-Lo's chicken get it to go! Hopefully that would be a better experience!

bE2EKV4l_0281KThTr3KIw.text: I'll start off by saying that the food at Lolo's is really good. I'm from Chicago where there is an over abundance of amazing food so I didn't think it was anything to write home about, but our waitress was amazing with the overload she was dealing with and very accommodating. But the food just didnt wow me but it was still good and at a very affordable price. The patron marg was fab! So if you are in the area and want brunch this is a solid option.

P3jdCH494MrFUISrrI1zNg.text: I like the food. Hot sauce is good. Warm syrup is a  nice little touch. Hostesses are nice. I work in the service industry just expected a little more from the bartender. 1. Printed my check 1min after ordering (didn't ask if wanted or needed anything else) 2. Waited until I was just about done to check if food was to my liking. 3. Didn't ask if needed change (payed 20 for 13) left it as it was anyway. Bartender was not busy at all.

CB5RteV0dAlhmEKMfUC8_w.text: Maybe the waffles are good I wouldn't know as I ordered the blackened fish which was so greasy it was swimming in oil. The mashed potatoes were like paste. Don't expect me to come back.

LoYTO-XkjZynav3qvH8wPA.text: This was the first time eating here and it was pretty busy on a Saturday afternoon but we were hungry so we sat down and ordered. I ordered Fried Green Tomatoes, Chicken and Waffles and my hubby orders the Biscuits and gravy.  We both enjoyed our meals so much and had leftovers to have later.  I had been craving fried green tomatoes for a good little while and I was truly satisfied with this part of my meal and the chicken was fried just right very tasty.  The biscuits were cake like and that gravy was yummy.  My hubby and I have a date morning every Saturday and we are always looking for a good breakfast and I think we may have found our new spot!

k5V4rZ-sGgpKJdrebnTGwQ.text: Food was delicious 4 stars..I understand they just opened we waited 30-40 min to be seated another 10-15 min to get our drinks had to ask someone who our server was no one had a answer..my date had to go find the manager to get some help once that was taken care of we finally got service staff is friendly...will definable go back

_6oBm_ZpqLCdrKDHb-Wlow.text: This is by far a home away from home meal. Great service, love the atmosphere. Fast friendly service  We'll be back lo lo chicken and waffles!

Rf452uyLnKfJXyUOm_H-nw.text: This evening my brother and I went to Lolo's for dinner. While there, we received the worst service. When we arrived there was only a large group and a few booths occupied. It took 15 mins. for someone to come to our table to take our drink order. When Brian came to the table he took our order and brought our drinks. We then waited another 30 mins for our server to come to the table. She immediately asked what we were eating for dinner without introducing herself. She finally introduced herself after we ordered. We waited a hour for our food to come to the table. The food was good but the chicken was dry. It would have been easier to bare if we would have had drink refills but that did not happen. I finally had to wave someone down to get a drink and a box. She then followed the guy I waved down to the table with the check (which was the 2nd time she came to the table). I stated that her service was horrible. She said "I know, you don't have to tip me." Brian then asked what was going on and she told him our issue. His solution was to come back and ask for him and he would take care of us. He also went out of his way to state it again as we were leaving. But, you don't have to worry about that! Any place that doesn't value it's customers isn't a place to eat at all.

dPVoV9gb0HSh_Al6nQ2AEA.text: Finally, went to LoLo's in Vegas.  I was skeptical due to 3 stars but glad my friend and I decided to have breakfast there.  We always go to Lo-Lo's in Phoenix on Central when were in AZ, but glad Vegas has an establishment here.  The food was great, love the catfish.  They gave large portion .  We will definitely be back due to the food and service was outstanding everyone is very friendly.  The atmosphere was awesome!!!

7oP1YSIdpS8sZE-dM4XSTQ.text: Food was ok. Service WAS AWFUL WILL NOT BE BACK. Took hour and 45 minutes for lunch waited 20 minutes for drinks asked waitress tiybring tartare sauce she didn't bring it.  Asked food delivery person for tartare sauce asked waitress again took another 10 minutes.   My food was cold waitress got a 6 cent tip. Was generous considering

-w_9zsOFCd3U7gDwdCOb9Q.text: So it was pretty slow when we came in got seated right away and the waitress was super friendly and the food came out fast. And I really love the decor in the place. fCquNxrlvcmR1Lm1DFqKDA.text: Horrible. This place was extremely empty when we arrived and yet we had to request a server. My friend's waffle was nice and golden brown like a waffle should be. my Waffle was very light in color and soft. I bit into the waffle and I could taste batter. The waffle is undercooked. The waitress brought a new waffle but it looks and taste exactly the same. I show her what is batter . The waitress says,  if you want a waffle golden brown you need to order it well done otherwise it's going to come out soft. (I have no reason to lie on this lady) I said my friend did not order a well done waffle and why didn't the waitress asked me if I wanted a undercooked, slightly cooked, or well-done waffle? The waitress says your friend probably got someone else's waffle. She then brings me a well done  golden brown delicious waffle .  I order grits,eggs, and fried chicken too . The Grits were extremely watery and the chicken was  seriously overcooked. Most of the food was still on the table when she brought the bill. Waitress said I didn't charge you for the other two waffles. I told her I would not have paid for raw food. I gave two stars because my mojito and my friends Kool-Aid vodka cocktail were absolutely delicious. I did order a 2nd cocktail but it never made it to the table. I thought the prices were acceptable. There's ample parking, it's easy to find, and they have one hell of a bartender. I don't know his name but he was the only Caucasian man behind the counter. It's located pretty far off the strip so I'm sure I won't go back. My experience matches the name of the restaurant.

R6Is2dLtrVmQ22JjPnxV3g.text: We've been trying to get into this place to taste the food when it wasn't so busy and today was the day!  Yummy, chicken and waffles sounded so good!!!  Arrived about 1:09pm, waited until 1:17 to be seated (2nd booth from the front, left of bar).  Watched our server bring food, then condiments to both, booths 1 and 3, twice each, as we reviewed our menus and made all our selections....still waiting to even be acknowledged.  No smile, no hello, no kiss my a**, not even a look.  We walked out at 1:33.  I don't know how good the food is...and likely never will...but I do know the service is severely lacking.

DAp7qXbKEKepKQRtxRHAzw.text: Slow food service, my daughter and I finished our food before my wife and sons food arrived. This was a let down as we have had better luck in the past.

wMoSkANRVCFa45bDkABJ-g.text: This place used to be great. I don't know what happened but I used to love coming here. Food used to even taste better. This place has definitely fallen off the grid.

vBMYJ4cBa0_3LPKq-daOaQ.text: I have ordered food from here several times when they first opened and the food was great compared to now. Back then I was obsessed with their banana pudding - the best to me by far.   Today we ordered food for the office and got the banana pudding. I hate to admit it but, we were not impressed!! Definitely not the same quality and quantity of food as before. It's very unfortunate. I don't think we will be returning.

w-H9li8lQULigF1gjwHqzw.text: Was very surprised how delicious this place is.  You can really tell they cook the food with love which is rare nowadays.  Server Kiki was chill and tentative.  The atmosphere is laid back (we loved the music) and the bloody bacon mary was delicious.  We all literally felt like sloths when we left because we were just ready to nap because it was so damn good will come back for sure!

w8GsiUXV4nPqJrIBnpzaRw.text: I love this place but every time we come in here the servers are so short staff that we sat here for 30 minutes before anyone said anything to us and once that happened the waitress already had 5 tables! I saw so many people not being served! Or even greeted that it was embarrassing. This place attracts so many people traveling and this Memorial Day weekend! This shouldn't be the case that people continuously get seated but no one at least greeting them. We finally had a young lady come to us that took our order at 1030 and 11 hit and no food yet. We asked for the server to get the manager we live here in Las Vegas and if the service will continue to be this way then we will NEVER be back here! We just realized guest that arrived 20 minutes after us was served before us! Another group seated 10 minutes after us is being served! We received our food at 1120 and asked to speak to the manager at 1045 whom STILL HAVEN'T CAME! Nate (the manager) finally came gave a discount. My husband has over 500,000 followers all it takes for a bad review and many people will not come. Living in Vegas and being able to come back and see how the experience will be will definitely determine how that next review go. Sonya the waitress was AMAZING!!! And we appreciate her picking us up when no one else seemed to want too. Thank you!!!

0Ikp4yP7lVt_8SNg1BcWrA.text: So this was sour first time eating here an j grave to say it was great. But let me say come hungry because the portions are huge. Our server Jazz was amazing. He said it was very good just that the gravy was a little salty. Jazz our server said that next time we come to let them know an they can out the gray on the side. I had the the 3 piece beats an 2 waffles. It was great an ended up taking some home. All I. All the food an service was great. Even the manager came over to ask us how everything was...I can't wait to go back an try the chicken strips next time. Hope we have the same experience
