FcllgZkmox06yqwdhB3arg.text: The chicken and waffles was cooked very good... I will definitely be coming back here many more times...

F-uwecD3HfsccBkBdw8l_Q.text: We were waited by Sparky.   I got a 3 piece  all white meat. My wife got a Hood burger. Sparky was an amazing waiter. He's very personable and humble person. He made my wife and I feel like we were the only couple in the restaurant. We weren't, but he made us feel like it.   The chicken was very tasty and moist. The greens and mac and cheese was very good, and way better then Roscos.   My wife said: The hood burger was really good. It was juicy and very flavor-able.   As far as prices, not expensive in my opinion.

sVtZ88biim64CpTHonJqpw.text: Ok, so I'm being generous because of Rouyon's good customer service. But, as for the food itself, well let's just say that the chicken was bland, my burger was medium well when I asked for well done and the drinks were watery. Other than that, the Stupid fries were good and the waffles were okay. That was the only saving grace for this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The stupid fries were decent and the waffles were good.
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asked for my burger to be cooked &#34;well&#34; and it came out &#34;medium well&#34;. I didn&#39;t send it back...you know why.

66K7kmPVPvbdB7C61vdHuA.text: Came in on a Sunday afternoon. As expected it was kinda busy, not slammed. We ordered 2 muddy waters which came right away then we preceeded to wait for our food for 45 mins or so. Which is again, to be expected.  We ordered the Malaysia burger, medium well, with jalapeno mayo and an over easy egg. We also ordered the sammich and opted for catfish.  Let me start by saying our waitress never asked how our food was. Maybe because she knew my burger was cold, with a fried hard egg , and a medium rare cook. I was extremely disappointed. My hubby's fish sammich on the other hand was piping hot, and delicious.  Our server did not ask how our food was, or if we needed anything. We have ordered before and asked for it to go. I think we will stick with that In the future , the employees seemed to be more concerned about the football games than anything else.  I am still giving 3 stars because one bad experience is not enough for me to be too dissapointed.

B4KgBU6arix9-wdhbrmNMA.text: Such high hopes, so disappointed. Wife and I had chicken and waffles, kids breakfast.  Wife's tenders were bland, mine came out so overcooked the meat was like leather. I never complain (7 years in food service) but had to send them back. Second set of chicken, and the skin was separated from the meat cause the meat was so dry. I couldn't eat either.   Kids loved the pancakes, and the sweet tea and kool-aid were great or else I'd give this a 1 star.

e55fvfeg9ACt3EJLacGcxQ.text: Very clean and new restaurant. With family from Los Angeles, I have eaten the famous Roscoos Chicken and waffles and heard about this place and thought I would give it a try with a  friend. We ordered The KK and split it. The chicken and waffles were better than Roscos overall. The place is a little pricey and there is a $3 up charge to have one piece of white meat instead of all dark meat on the combo? The food was good but the Grits were terrible and so was the service. Slow to refill my drink and to take my order. a couple changes and they could get 4 or 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AtBBvs1ZXHc3vxBMj6mG1g.text: I have been to this place a handful of times . The food is usually really delicious. But they are inconsistent. Today I went and my chicken had a burnt taste . My rice was a bit hard. The customer service is always excellent. This is one of my favorite places to eat. I love the southern food. They just need to be consistent with the food . Make sure the food is always good. Also , please keep syrup to the tables :)

BmhmKbjVC-oFJ496i1LN3w.text: The Fried Chicken is Good average Waffles, I did like the Chorizo and eggs although a little dry but the food was pretty good, I have heard good and bad things about Lolos.... and from what I can tell they are probably all correct. I heard bad things about the service especially and we came in at a slow time so the service wasnt bad, but they still could have come by to check on us a little more since it was slow and they did not. I guess nothing wrong with trying this place as I have passed by many times. It is decent and will come back again, but I will be in absolutely no hurry to do so. Sweet tea is pretty good

BfKDgVoH8Zf4DYJNLqDquQ.text: I have visited this place a few different times and have never been disappointed. Although Service can be hit or miss if they. Are busy and just overwhelmed but its still good to fantastic each time. They always take care of you. Food is great alway comes out hot. A must try is the Chicken & Waffles

TNK2-PHBGjfZojWmYRNVjQ.text: So far it's a zero. Got 15 open tables and the hostess is holding up seating people. Not a good first impression. I take that it doesn't first impression doesn't  matter when your business is crowded.

sb4Y0JNrfx7T37Ln1smmrA.text: We were looking for something before we headed back to LA.  This place was close.  We called ahead to  place our order, but still had to wait another 30 min after we arrived.  Food was average.

0RNiOInQlabvurVjhQzn2Q.text: My first Chicken and Waffle experience, was the best. We met Spark who is the bartender there, who hooked us up with a fresh batch of fried chicken, waffles, with some warm maple syrup, then some refreshing Kool-Aid on tap.... He even brought us some biscuit to go with our meal. My family and I felt right at home. For dessert we had their rated number 1 Red Velvet cake.

EQ4KdfSThl2Jd4AfZGtw7g.text: This was a very disappointing experience. The waitress seemed impatient and wasn't very friendly. The manager came by and sort of awkwardly asked us to leave a tip? It was strange. The chicken and waffles were subpar at best. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone and certainly would not eat here again.

tqanvS46fR4W7TQNNDA6vA.text: I really wanted to like this place... but their wait time from getting our drinks to getting our food was nuts. We sat there for 15 mins. before someone even asked if anyone got our drink order. When we got the food, it was great but the food was cold and not worth that 1 hour wait for food. never again

O-cxIl4E5Ugz5qsfsiFfwg.text: Really disappointing...service was inattentive and very slow, food was cold took forever to get, very expensive...

WYI4sY7qEZt_7mBbxpBW4g.text: We love LoLo's chicken and waffles more than Roscoe's! I will say when they first opened the service was not that great and they were not organized, but each time we have been back the service has improved. The food is always great and the portions are right in line with their pricing. I always get the Betty's boob and it breast portion is always a DD breast size...lol. Their bathroom is always clean as is their restaurant. My only critique is the greeters could be more friendly they seem like they are never in a good mood when we come in.   The last time we were there, my husband mentioned that it was our daughter's birthday and the server and some other staff member's came and sang to her and gave her a free slice of cake. That to me is great customer service!

mWbgK6-6HI-Wl1ndM7kJVA.text: Lolos is a aweaome place.. we hhave been looking for that home cooked meal type of feel, where the cook uses seasing, this place delivered  that. You cannot call in abead thats one downfall i think. The other con is how loud the music is, i wiuld understand if it was after yom but at 10qm having club music blaring can be a bit much. The waffle is so amazing  it is a must try, just like the greens mac and cheese fried okra and lemonaid omg so good. The way they make their cheese eggs and grits is wow.. i never had grits bur these bad boys are off the chain. Buscuts and gravy  was good but they deff need to not be so skiny with the gravy. If you wanr the rest of your dri k to go it costs you$1. Sometimes the wait can be to long. If you went to lolo in the past and didnt like ot try it again, its by new ownership now. Thre stars due to the wait times,  ot sure why they have people waiti g so lo g at times when they have so many open tables, the loud music is a bit much, the fzct you have to buy your to go cup and the gravy o  a biscuits  seriouskyit left 5he biscuits  dry. But the flavor the staff make up for it to give it 4 stars

r92HF2hCqlcUWaamwVdudg.text: I was excited to see that there was a Lo Lo's here in Las Vegas (I'd discovered then in Phoenix). Was out with the family and decided to take everyone and introduce the wife and kids to the amazing food.  Just before noon we arrived. Lots of people already there, but we got on the list and were given the estimate of 25-30 mins.  After 45 mins, I checked the link they'd sent to my phone. Turns out that takes you to yelp, which tracks your place on line.  My app said there were 16 parties ahead of us.  After 45 mins, we'd only moved up two spots.  I'd been sitting inside and went inside again to ask and noticed that everyone who'd arrived before us was already seated.  The girls at the front told me that I had another 5 mins or so.  I went and informed the family.  I went back inside to observe and noticed that there were more than 20 open tables around the place (heavily understaffed).  Then, I noticed that they began seating people who had arrived long after we had.  I asked again what was going on and was told that I was looking at another 30 minutes at a minimum.  We'd already been waiting for over an hour!  I watched them again seat people, without even trying to hide it, who had just come in.  I'm so angry. We were polite there and didn't raise a stink about it, but their business practices are disgusting and we'll not be back.  I looked for their manager, but couldn't find him/her. Finally, after spending 1 hour and 45 minutes too long of our lives there, we left.  I hate crappy businesses.

Qc587e9rXIUbFC6maQ6MNw.text: The food was delicious and our server was extremely nice and had a wonderful personality.  We unfortunately had to wait for our food well over 45 minutes and our waitress tried to come to bat for us waiting so long and her manager didnt even want to give us even bread for the long wait. Unacceptable to keep your patrons waiting almost an hour for food with no explanation.  We got there at 245p and didnt leave until 456 due to the long wait for food!

sAZOFr-rLV-4EdpaQyMaAA.text: We were the first customers to enter for breakfast. They sat us in the bar area where a manager was. Every time the manager would walk by a strong smell of marijuana would hit our table. We even over heard the people behind us make a comment about the smell, as well. We requested to move to the dining area, where they sat us in a booth that had not been cleaned from the previous night. The server Drei took our order and we never saw her again until we asked for the check. The bus boy was incredible. He brought out the food (brought out the over easy eggs they forgot which turned out to be over cooked and other condiments needed), brought our drinks and provided refills, and was super apologetic and polite!   Place was dirty, heavily smelled like marijuana, and was just an overall uncomfortable experience.

M2KIpAcdMu0FQyMYYQe43g.text: We came into today around 3pm with a group of four. No wait. I did call before to check on the wait. Our server, Jazzy was amazing. Very attentive and super courteous. Even the person who helped that was a trainee was really nice. Now the food.....I am from Chicago and I travel a lot so I have had Chicken and Waffles from the best....it was outstanding and fresh. She gave us the history of the restaurant and family's story. We even learned the kids names. Jazzy was like family during our visit and had us cracking up. Go check this place out. I really don't understand the bad reviews. Everything is fresh so drink some Koolaid and be patient; let them cook the food with love. I will be back soon.  Food recommendations: Sweet potatoes  Smothered potatoes Greens Catfish  Chicken  Cornbread

WLqHVsXgG_TcZ6q5gH2GCg.text: Best ever I will fly to Vegas just for this chicken and Waffles anytime. So good chicken fried perfect waffles crispy outside tender and soft inside

D1MtKZJhJTLMzEusW4zVDQ.text: I want to start off my saying we will NOT be back to this place and its not bc of the food. Its bc of the service, we me re received r drinks or r food.  We walked in and it was pretty busy but got seated very fast bc it was just 2 of us. So after we were seated not one person came over to us to take our drink order we wanted for more than 10 mins as people walked past us and I watched as others were being seated and waited on but not us, finally someone stoped and asked us if we had been waited in and we ofcouse said no. Right in front of us was our waitress running around waiting on everyone else but us, and the guy that asked us if we had been waited on asked the girl right in front of us if we had been waited on he asked her to get our order and she said yes she, she just walked away and never came back.   no drinks and still no food.  We people sat there a total of 45 mins or so and nothing so we got up and left. So this is why I will not ever be going back to a place that treats others like this, I do not care how good the food could have been if the service is not good then the food will be just as bad. So No thank you I will not be eating at this place ever.

9FEkzdLYKhIuh3iHbZ_xCQ.text: Awesome of course. Chicken and waffles, with the hint of cinnamon. They got kool-aid But I opted for lemonade this time. We got seated fast, the waitress was real chill. Had a great lunch

PToUOtvqIuXuOY4U2Fc_OA.text: I came here for lunch with my mother in law. I tried to call ahead of time and place an order for pick up and was told that was not something they do. We really wanted to try this place out so we drove there, tons of open tables but was told it was a half hour wait time, that's no big deal. 90 minutes late we were seated. It took over 20 minutes before our drink order was taken we wanted to give our food order but was told she wasn't the person to do that. Another 10 minutes someone came to take out food order. It took 40 minutes before our food came out. 1......plate.....at...a......time. Why did I bother to come with someone, it's not like we got to eat together. Our check was delivered quick with the last plate but change, come on now, wouldn't want to mess up there flow would we???? And still this the place didn't get full. It wasn't just our table either. No one got their meals together. Your chicken came out then 20 minutes later your friends pancakes. 10 after that your mashed potatoes might come.  Really? I asked what the issue was and I was told the cook called out today. Looking at the other reviews, I think the cook calls out a lot. Don't waste your time, if you want to spend hours eating lunch go to some place that has the atmosphere to look at or maybe a live band for some kind of entertainment. It was awful

wQuyTULV9JFlitl6zimgpg.text: Lo-Lo's food was DELICIOUS. The chicken was cooked to perfection and the waffle was delicious. There was a wait when we arrived but it was shorter then expected. All the staff was super friendly from the hostess to the our server. Also it was a super fun atmosphere with a DJ, we dined there on a Saturday afternoon. Looking forward to visiting again!

ga-AqtNHfxeuiciOjsXKMA.text: The chicken was nasty.  My mate and I was very disappointed in the food that day.  The chicken tasted like old grease.  I should've followed my mind and not ate there that day.  I smelled it when I parked.

NIBt-HyNzRNGGiVLp0Ajsw.text: Great food! Great prices! Great staff! Great atmosphere! I really enjoyed my visit to Lo Lo's it was amazing! The portions and the prices are on point. When you go ask for Virginia she's soooooo good and she loves what she does.

V4J-U67RtelLLyitiTnXCQ.text: I loved this place ! As I entered the restaurant I was greeted immediately with friendly staff !!! We were seated less than 30 min met by another friendly staff  Virginia allowed us to preview the menu without rushing us suggested some food choices our food was delicious hot and fresh !!!! The coolaid was good large portions!!!! I'm a foodie specialist this place overwhelmingly scores a A+ not to mention Kevin Johnson former Phoenix Suns NBA player served us he was so humble he talked with my husband and son this restaurant is 1st class and also very clean great music I'm looking forward to one being built in the Inland Empire Rialto California or Rancho Cucamonga!!!

kfEr-bZs4iOKEyxM4QG3sg.text: From my husband, your mind should mirror my thoughts!!! So great to see Kevin Johnson and Former Chancellor Wi running this awesome restaurant!!!  The food was amazing , customer service was the bomb, and I wish they opened up one on the East coast !!! Good Food !!! Good Drinks !!! Good Service !!!

3h28ZoQLQL6Alu1Nv_ECxQ.text: I went on Easter so a little longer wait time was to be expected. I asked the host how long was the wait. She says 45 minutes. That time wasn't accurate. It was actually a 72 minute wait. I did like that once you checked in they texted you when your table was ready. Once we were seated we were greeted immediately and given drinks. The Koolaid was great. We ordered and the waiting began. I had to ask the waiter do you know how long for our food? He said it should be out shortly and when he came back he brought the food that was about 50 minutes after we ordered. I ordered #3. LoLo's the chicken was seasoned well. The waffle was ok I prefer a crunchy waffle this one has kinda soft. My hubby ordered the Soulfood platter with 2 pieces of fried catfish, cornbread, fried okra, and Mac cheese. He liked the fish. I thought it was too Fishy. The cornbread was ok and the Mac and cheese was soupy. The okra was good. My daughter ordered the shrimp and Mac cheese. I must say this was very tasty.  The service was just subpar I had to request a fork several times from the waiter since I dropped mine. I also requested and extra plate which I never got. Also we were not offered to order dessert. Overall I would probably not return. It wasn't a great impression.

aCBUj60qjy-6L_aaqPu2Aw.text: Very bad service to start at the front door. The greeter (angela) told my party we can't be seated because we're missing 2 member's of the party smh. UyC-u1rjXojST9DFvjpzOw.text: I wanted to take my wife out to lunch here at lolos chicken and waffles and I gotta say the service here  is by the the worst experience ever at a restaurant. The host didn't give a shit about us, she had an attitude, she didn't recognize us upon arrival and didn't notice we were standing in line to put our names in. She actually looked past us and greet other customers who were arriving. The mimosas were way over priced. I paid $7.50 for a large mimosa and she gave me a medium drink in a large glass. Before we were even seated, I asked the host if we can sit at the bar and she says yes but you have to buy a drink and I said ok. As we were sitting down at the bar, a waitress says we can't sit there because it's not to drink or eat there, I was really confused.  I probably will never go to lolos chicken just because of the service, not to mention there were tons of open seating and nobody could be seated in them. You'll never get that issue at roscoes chicken and waffles the real chicken a waffles. It's only a matter of time lolos chicken will be going out of business if they don't fix the issue and fast.

kcEdWyr2BkPxAnjfJe3oCA.text: Soon as I heard there was a location in Las Vegas I had to come and check it out since I'm living back on the West Coast. It's been about 4 years since I left North Scottsdale, AZ.  Anyway I went in after noon to celebrate my BIRTHDAY on May 7th around 2pm and I had the BEST server named Krystal (I believe) and all of the other ladies assisting her (Sonya was one) were great as well.   The Food... I ordered the chicken & waffle meal that comes w/ 3 pieces of meat, scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese & onions and grits. It was yummy prepared just right! The atmosphere was good and I enjoyed the music. Boy did I miss "Lo-Lo's Chicken & Waffles!"  One request....  I asked to speak to the manager upon entering the restaurant. He was sitting in a booth by the bar talking with someone. I just wanted to say it was my BIRTHDAY, how I MISSED eating at Lo-Lo's and I was hoping for a great experience at this location.  Guess what? He NEVER came over to my table!  He didn't even walk around the restaurant like some managers do to check on their guest. I was really surprised that he didn't come to my table especially since I asked the young lady/Hostess at the front as soon as I walked in. Did SHE tell him? Did HE forget or what? Neither one of them knew WHY I asked to speak to management. SMH!   In conclusion ....  The wait staff (ladies) sung "Happy Birthday" to me and made my day with such GREAT service they provided. I applaud the wait staff! You ladies ROCKED!   I first gave 5 stars and changed it to 4 stars due to the Manager not coming over to the table to address my need. Will I return?  HECK YEAH but maybe I'll get on the road and travel to the Scottsdale location since I'm not too far.

O2E5uWLukWbnDMZ6mQpQrg.text: Visited this place for the 1st time. My son and I both got the 2 piece chicken and waffles. He also got a side of Mac and Cheese. We wanted our waffles well done. It took a while to receive our meal and when it came our waffles were not well done. We had to get our server's attention and when I told her she was in such a rush I didn't get a chance to let her know not to reorder anymore... about 15 min went pass and she finally came back to ask if we rec'd the waffles and right at that moment is when our waffles came. Our drinks was never refresh or she never came back to see if everything was ok... this was BAD service and needless to say a tip was not left and although I don't live here we will not be back.

N765zoOWA_RJASp73UXm1Q.text: OMG.  Let me just say I've been to some good soul food places back home on the East coast. But Lo Lo's is on a whole 'nother level.  Before my friends and I left for our Vegas trip, I found this place via a travel site called Travel Noire. They featured Lo Lo's in an article they wrote about best places to visit in Las Vegas. They offered chicken and waffles and we're fans of those. Sold.   We arrived at the restaurant which kind of blends in with the shopping center it's in, right across a few fast food restaurants. Small parking lot but not too crazy. We entered those double doors to the hostess and was told there was a 30 minute wait. Ok. Sat at the bar while we waited and once we got to our seats, we were accommodated by Shanika (I hope I got that name right). She seemed a little rough on the edges at first but deep down we knew she was a bit stressed because she was one of the few waitresses serving (hence our wait, which is understandable). She softened up later and was helpful with us throughout. My one friend has an allergy to gluten and when confronted with the problem, Shanika went straight to the chef and he came out and told my friend they would make her a special dish, whatever she wanted, gluten-free style. We were such in awe!  The menu is vast but many reasonably priced items. All of the items have nicknames but I stuck to the three piece chicken with a double side of fries and cornbread deal (forgot the name). Along with that was a Georgia on my Mind drink. When I got those items, INSTANTLY I was in LOVE! The chicken was cooked to perfection, the flavor was awesome, the fries were seasoned right and that drink - yesss! A nice balance where I can taste the alcohol (peach Vodka) and sweetness. The only gripe I had was the cornbread, unfortunately. It wasn't buttery moist like I'd hope and not a lot of flavor. The other food overrode that and I was happy.  Two of my other friends also had chicken meals with the Lo Lo's Punch which they loved as well and they tried a sip of my drink and they ordered that drink for themselves too! My gluten-free friend received grilled chicken tenders and fries, no alcoholic drink though, and she loved it all!   Thus later in our trip, we took another venture to Lo Lo's and this time it was a 45 minute wait due to a big party. We rode around a bit during our wait, came back and everything was settled. This time, I ordered the Lo Lo's Chicken and Waffles with a cup of coffee. Of course, the chicken was consistently great. Those waffles are waffles I've never had before. I'm not even joking. I could taste the nutmeg, cinnamon and butter in every bite and the syrup just intensified it. True down-home cooking in this restaurant.  My gluten-free friend got grilled shrimp and my other two friends got shrimp and grits and the three chicken with sides deal. Everyone loved their meals too. One of my friends got the Blue Ivy drink which after I took a sip, it tasted like a Freeze-Pop, Squeeze-Pop whatever you want to call it (you know, those frozen flavored ice treats in the plastic tube that you have to squeeze up?) - scarily sweet without a hint of alcohol! My friend felt the vodka after about 20 minutes lol. Our waitress - whose name starts with an L, ohhh so sorry I forgot - was pleasant and helped us out with everything we needed as well.  All I know is, the next time I visit Las Vegas or even Arizona, I'm going back to Lo Lo's! I miss it so much lol.

5f5pfzxnEt2Pq6DILtEQNA.text: Let me start off by saying I LOVE LOVE LOVE the food here . If the food wasn't this good, I would never visit a restaurant with such poor customer service . g0PZ-lDLqm2s-Fuy53SHwQ.text: honestly, Lolos is our favorite spot to eat. top 10 for sure. the food is absolute fire. im from Cali and it blows roscoes out the water. food, lemonade, and the greatest 90s love songs including kc n jojo... but in vegas, it differs from the AZ spots because it lacks the service that Phoenix lolo has. we were served on a busy day and we never asked for a refill. they were on point and always checking on us.  but today in vegas, there was two other occupied tables and tho our server was very nice, we were kinda ditched after our first roubd of drinks, then food came and tasted awesome, but had nothing to wash it down with.   benefit of the doubt? vegas is full of snotty people and customer service becomes complacent? LOVE THE FOOD THO.

IakaW-_ww5xNUvTN7yfZPg.text: My boyfriend and I went here to try something new, I had a craving for fried chicken that day so we decided to check this place out. We walked in and we were immediately greeted with kindness and a smile so we figured so far, so good. Boy, were we wrong.  The place is huge to start off (not a bad thing particularly, but it's intimidating), we were sat down and a few minutes go by, our waitress finally comes up to the table. As kind a woman as she seemed to be, she also seemed exhausted like she didn't want to be there anymore. She takes our drinks down, another good few minutes go by and we finally get them. Mine was just an ice water and my boyfriend had gotten tea of some kind. She asks if we're ready to order and we say yes, I had gotten the pecan salad (I believe) and he had ordered a medium rare burger. We wait, and wait, and wait some more, finally about 40 minutes go by and out comes out food.  Except our waitress was gone. She had left in the middle of our dining in and gone home. Maybe it's just me, but who does that? Don't they at least finish off a table they have beforehand? Or at least stop by to tell us someone else will be serving us?  The chicken in my salad was dry and old, as though it had been left out for days before being used, I found a HAIR in my food, and there was no flavor whatsoever. My boyfriends burger came out rare, nearly raw and inedible. The guy who took over never came by to refill our drinks- or at least waited until the glasses were completely empty and ice was at a quarter mark on the cups. And to top it all off, he gave us the WRONG bill for another table that was at least 100+$! Pay attention to the table your serving so they don't have a damn heart attack over this stuff! When we got our actual bill it for 30-40$ for crappy food. We ran away and will never, ever, come back. Stay away from this place!

CwV3m5OqJ3nOW1p2S-xQnA.text: A chicken and waffle place? Based out of Arizona? I know what you're thinking. "Dont knock it til you try it" right?   So I come in on a thursday night about 7:15. Place was not all that busy but enough for the the staff to stay busy. We got a table right away which should be expected for the restaurant was only half full.  As I go over the menu I see that a lot of the food names are in relation to "Da Hood". Things like Baby Ray, Betty's Boob, and Tre-Tre's. That's for the chicken choices. I find it funny because when you're in "Da Hood", good food usually does not cost an arm and a leg. And it tastes good. What im saying is the food here does not taste good at all. Compared to Roscoe's Lo Lo's chicken does not have as much flavor.  So what I got was the Sheeda's Special ($11) and Fried Okra ($4) and Home Fries ($4). The Sheeda's Special was a chicken breast and wing along with a waffle. The chicken was bland and extra greasy, like they were in a hurry to serve it and didnt really give it enough time for the grease to drain properly. The waffle was plain bad. It was soggy and you can taste some cinnamon mixed into it. Putting a lot of syrup on it almost made it taste ok. Since thats all you get for the Sheeda's Special, I opted to get a the side of fried okra and home fries. The okra was soggy and literally had grease dripping from it. I guess it was the same person who pulled it out of the fryer and didnt give it enough time to drain? The fried okra at Dickey's barbeque was way better. The home fries were tasteless. The only thing I could taste was the onions and green peppers that were cooked with it. The potatoes were dry.  Service was almost non existent. I think I only interacted with my server twice. Once for taking the my order and then the second time bringing out my food. I take that back. Actually 3 times but the 3rd time didnt really count. The iced tea that she gave me literally looked like mud. I took a sip and I swear I could taste tea grounds. So I had her change it out for a diet soda.  Some things I wanna mention. One of the servers there look like they could be a Jonas brother. Only this guy was cut. You guys should take a pic with him and say he was helping out at Lo Lo's that day. After I ordered I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and they were out of paper towels so I mentioned it to one of the servers. After we got done eating about an hour later, I went to wash my hands again and STILL no paper towels. Fail.  Overall, this place is way overpriced, overhyped, and the service is terrible. I am definitely not coming back. On a side note if you want really good chicken and fried catfish, go check out Sunny's Chicken and Fish over towards North Las Vegas off of Lamb and Washington. You can get a 2 piece breast and wing with waffle for $3.99! For the price of a Sheeda's Special you can almost get 3 orders at Sunny's! His chicken and fried catfish taste way better and it is what I use to compare other chicken/waffle/catfish places! Plus the location is actually in a "hood" part of town so Lo Lo's got nuthin on this place! Sunny's is probably the best kept secret in regards to great chicken and catfish. If you go, tell him Roger sent you! Matter of fact, I had to go there the very next day just to get over the bad experience at Lo Lo's! I dont usually mention other restaurants in my reviews but in this case I feel bad that you guys are missing out if you havnt been to Sunny's! Plus your wallet will thank you!  Yelp 2016 Review #18 "Just say no no to Lo Lo's Chicken" 591 overall

aAodDVQGjaVnwOnSnrgE2g.text: It was our first time here and we went for the Free Fried Chicken Friday Event. What a great way to bring us in to try some delicious fried chicken!! From the beginning, the host was nice and greeted us with a smile. Once we got seated, our waiter came to take our order and introduced the promotion. We were pleased with his great humor and energy while talking to us. We got the chicken and waffle and chicken with Mac and Cheese. Ohhhhh my goodness!!!! The seasoning on the chicken was spot on amazing! The salty seasoning with the sweet warm syrup and waffle couldn't be anymore perfect. It's a must have together! The Mac N Cheese was creamy and flavorful. I loved it!! We ordered a side of rice & gravy + fried okra. The fried okra was perfectly fried. Not greasy at all and perfect amount of breading!! The manager went around to greet all of us. I love the energy and the friendly environment. Can't wait to bring people here with us next time. Hope this post helped! Cheers to FRIED FRIDAYS!!!

gFxnbZ5KnAO9yR1nnpQ3ag.text: I'm from the south and most restaurants never get it right. The greens were fresh ..the mac and cheese was on point. The portions size was more than enough. We will be back. Shaniece gave great service

A7z6HNFopDXnZ4U-nmwCpA.text: KiKi was our server and the service was excellent,. She was attentive, interactive and gave some suggestions. The food was ok. The mac and cheese leaves a lot to be desired and the shrimp were overcooked. The chicken breast were juicy and flavorful. I may go back and just stick with chicken and waffles

_DkRfsMaSGRb-JFZCjtywg.text: Ooh la la, Lo-Lo's Chicken is da best in the west! Actually, this restaurant is located in The Best of the West shopping center, near McDonald's.  Been wanting to try it, but place is pretty busy on weekends. So, we checked it out for an early lunch on Friday and got right in.  There were waves of patrons in and out of the lower dining area, but the bar area with the pub tables seem to have availability so we'll keep that in mind, too.  Nice open feel to the building, wood-look floors, red leather booths, and vintage touches with bold art pieces.   Our server Chevy was friendly and happy to answer our many questions.  We decided to be initiated with the standards--chicken and waffles, with sides of dirty rice and gravy with onions, washed down with unsweetened southern tea and half&half tea.  BF and I both loved the hot chicken, well seasoned and crunchy fried exterior, tender juicy meat.   Super large chicken pieces, too.  (Note to smaller appetites, go with the Lil Amadi or risk lugging around a doggy bag after lunch.)  We both had never tried chicken and waffles before and didn't quite understand the fuss, but we do now!  Buttered, soft waffles with maple syrup make the perfect base for a piece of crispy chicken. A fork full of a delish, unexpected combination.   Oh, why did we wait so long to discover this? Now we have to make up for lost time.  The dirty rice is made with gizzards, so if you're used to Popeye's dirty rice, you'll be put off.  It's a bit on the dry side, so be warned.  The gravy is the red gravy and was topped with a few slices of nearly raw onions, not my favorite.  Just glad they did the chicken and waffles well!  Planning to try other selections next time as the menu was fairly extensive.  I know it's a chain restaurant,  but it celt.loke a local diner.  Glad it's in Vegas.

Waitress was rude and you could tell she had a problem. Will not be returning. Unfortunate because it had so much potential had it been fresh.

C2EQr9hcC9kf54dFD_d6gA.text: So we went here, we get out of the car and several people say don't go in there, there's a rat (note: these people's outburst is not the fault of the restaurant but the clientele) we decide to go in anyways. rk_3vwWs5WsUDV08sgoUEg.text: I heard the food was good. It smelled good as it was being served to others all around us. What I'm trying to say is, we were never served!!! My husband and I went in earlier this week 2/9/16 and sat by the bar and took about 5 minutes to read through a menu that made our mouths water. We placed our order with a waitress that was fairly pleasant and brought us our water. My husband and I got into a heated discussion that distracted us from the fact that 20 minutes rolled by and no food. When I checked the time and realized its been 20 minutes since we ordered we started really observing food coming in and out of the kitchen but nothing to our table. We also counted and realized there were 4 different groups of people that came in after us and they got their food. Finally the waitress comes by and says that they were frying my catfish and wanted to make sure it was done right. Come on now! Catfish don't take that long!!! After waiting for 40 minutes total we decided to get up and leave. As we walked towards the door a lady(employee) ran up to us saying no no don't leave yet! She grabbed my husband's shoulder and my arm (highly inappropriate) to stop us from walking out. She said something like please don't leave I'm sorry I will get your check.  I'm assuming she meant she'd comp the meal for being incompetent. I calmly said we were done and my husband and I walked out.  A. Who was she?  B. Where did she come from?  C. If she knew there was an issue with our meals why didn't she come to our table to address it before?  Bad service!!! Terrible! They weren't even busy enough to justify that faux pad!!!  Too bad! I had high hopes for this place since It opened up down the street from my home. By the way I gave it 1 star because the water was refreshing.

I guess they didn't do a great job with the hiring of servers but atleast the chicken is good !

kfcCgKKrB-Vy-w15qzWztA.text: Amazing food and friendly service. I'm constantly amazed at how the staff treats you like family every single time! Thank you for being such excellent food to the Valley!

qplQVCDWkGmevYMG66rsMQ.text: Came in for lunch today and they had a 20 minute wait. Cool, no problem, we're ready to wait for some awesome chicken and waffles! We were sat and gave our order to our server Chevy, she was very nice and friendly. Waiting about 20 minutes, still no drinks. Our server comes and says it'll be another 15-20 mins for food, we say it's fine but can we at least have our drinks lol we watched a couple of tables get their food at about 10-15 mins after their order, so we think our server forgot. A food runner comes to our table and brings food we didn't order, it was for the next table. At this point we just think it's really funny no one seems to know what they're doing. Of course they've been opened for only a week so we just laugh it off. About 10 minutes go by and our server comes again saying everything's coming should be just a few more minutes. Finally maybe after 50 minutes we get our food. We ordered 3 plates of chicken and waffles, cornbread, mac and cheese, pineapple upside down pancakes, and the corn fritters. We got everything together except the corn fritters. We asked the server and she said they should be coming, she forgot again lol those were supposed to be starters but it came last, when we were almost done. The chicken is delicious! Throw some hot sauce and honey on it and you're good to go! Oh yeah the server only wanted to give us one side of honey? We asked if we have to pay for another side and she didn't seem to know so we just settled for the one side she gave us lol anyway, the waffle I didn't like so much, as other reviews say, it's quite soggy. It really is more like a pancake. It's weird how soggy it was. Mac and cheese was ok. The corn bread was a bit hard but the inside was ok. The pineapple upside down pancake wasn't worth the $13. The corn fritters were great! Crunchy and creamy and sweet and spicy all in one bite! I would come back to have some chicken and those corn fritters! I'm hoping their service will get better, they were friendly, just forgetful and confused lol

Two pieces of chicken hot enough to have just been cooked, the beans and rice side dish was hot but disappointing. In a small dish sat a mound of white rice topped with a tablespoon of beans, no sauce no substance. The mac 'n cheese was lukewarm, at best, not freshly prepared and lacking any distinguishing flavours. I had to put ground centuries ago black pepper on it. The watermelon koolaide in a large mason jar was refreshing, would have preferred cherry but they don't have that either( no liquor license). Ambience? None unless screaming kids is your thing while eating and paying $15 for lunch. Not mine. A no no for me.

w4O04SNQUZDBxhPuhTXPmA.text: First impressions all everything. Once I entered the restaurant I was not greeted or welcomed and it was 4 employees at the  hostess counter. Once I let them know how many people were in my party  (12) two of the employees tried to discourage us from staying. Then told me it would be a very long wait.  One employee stated that parties of 8 or more will not be seated together and if we did we could only order certain things off the menu. To my surprise I asked why? She stated because anything that was not number 1-16 would back the kitchen up. My first thoughts was were not eating here, but it was my nephew's birthday so we waited it out.  After a 45 minute wait and many empty tables we were seated.  It took 10 minutes after we were seating for our waitress to even acknowledge us. Once we did order she told us they didn't have any alcohol which was clearly advertised on the menu. When our food came out she forgot two of our orders. Then two of the orders were completely wrong. The food was okay nothing spectacular. The pancakes were very dry and the sausages were under cooked. The shrimp and grits was good,  but greasy. Maybe things will get better after a couple months of them being open, but I will not be back.

cQQ64pLpyUpPeNFZ4ZkTyA.text: Knock off BURNT microwave version of KFC. Coming from a southern girl, this is NOT soul food. Chicken has no seasoning & it's dry.The waffles are flat & soggy. Not fresh. The coffee is watered down.  I sent the chicken breast back because it was black. Server gave me a "new" piece which was exactly the same. Poor ghetto rude service. 1r8WgQXtvYTc5mQNqGrDmQ.text: Tried them for the first time about a week ago and absolutely loved the place. The food and service were great and I knew I'd be back. However, my experience this week was a nightmare. The wait to be seated was shorter than expected for the lunch hour, about 15-20 minutes. Once seated it was 15+ minutes before anyone took my drink order and that was only AFTER I went and notified the hostess I was still waiting. My server (props to her, Misty, she was awesome) came and apologized and explained she had several tables inside and no one informed her that they had sat customers in her section outside. She took my order and went about her business checking on our party multiple times. Misty explained that the kitchen was slightly backed up because they had gone to the full menu this week and the kitchen couldn't keep up. After about 30-45 minutes of waiting for our meal, I asked Misty to bring me the manager...all of them, because this was ridiculous. The manager, pleasant lady named Barbara-jean came and apologized and restated what Misty had said multiple times, and that she would personally go check on our meal. About 10 minutes later the food arrives, waffles so cold the butter wasn't melting and the chicken, apparently, had been fried for an hour...YESTERDAY! It was burned beyond recognition and no where near edible. I was promptly brought "fresh" chicken and guess what, a piece of it was worse than the first plate. I get new restaurants have their issues but what happened here goes beyond unacceptable! I'll give them one more shot maybe in about a month, if they are still in business, but only because of the way Misty and Barbara-jean handled things, and memories of my first visit.

K_bIJixw5rqjWDZTstSmEQ.text: Waited 10 minutes at the door no one said anything to us when I asked the hostess about getting seated she gave me attitude said she's busy cleaning tables when there  was a dozen tables open.  Why would I pay to eat there with employees like that?

GwPoDsDQirceTyR68okMPQ.text: My charge nurse recommended this place since I live about 10 minutes away from it and that her family just loves Chicken and Waffles. So I tried going on a Wednesday after my night shift and to my dismay found out they open at 9. I got there at 8:30 and wasn't planning on staying for another 30 minutes since I'm already sleepy. So I gave it another go on Friday.  The place was roomy. It has a bar on the middle which was pretty spacious. Multiple screen TVs where you can get your sports on if you happen to fancy eating waffles and drinking beer at the same time while watching the Olympics. I was seated on a booth (to my surprise) and the place wasn't as busy when I went (which was good).   I forgot the servers name but he was really nice. He looked like he had a busy morning because even with only two customers he was huffing and puffing. The menu had plenty to offer. Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner or a combination of the two or three if you wish. I went ahead and ordered Lolo's Chicken and Waffles since well that's what I came for. I saw from reviews that they also liked the Banana Pudding so I ordered that one too.  On to the food. The Waffles were soft, a hint of Cinnamon is there but not overpowering. The butter they served with it was perfect and just made me smile seeing that gold turn to liquid (yeah I'm a fat ***). To my surprise it was the chef that served the food to me! I mean I'm sorry if I put everybody on an inconvenience by going there for lunch. Either that or he was just happy to serve the food he made. But he looked really nervous for some reason. I don't bite. Well not unless your food that is *wink*. So he told me he'd be back with syrup and yes he did. The syrup was warm and went perfectly with the waffles. It was good but I was never really into waffles or had not had too many growing up so there wasn't really anything for me to compare it too. But the taste was just right. There wasn't any after taste or anything that you would usually get if the batter came from a box. And no I'm not saying it came from a box. I'm just saying the ones that come from a box have aftertaste is all. I know very well they make theirs from scratch. Which is a good thing.  The chicken!!! Okay so I'm a big fan of fried chicken. And growing up having been a patron of another restaurant I have a lot to say about Lolo's fried chicken. First of all they are big! As in it looks like they gave me the whole chicken with the three piece I got. All that was missing was the head. The portion is good for someone who's about ready to eat a horse but I believe I ordered too much for my appetite this time around. The skin was crispy but needs a little salting on some parts of the chicken. The taste didn't overpower the waffles and actually went great with them. The meat was tender and became very addicting as I dug through and through. It didn't compare to previous ones that I've had but it paired nicely with the soft waffles they made. But like I said it was just way too much for my appetite this time around and actually had to take some to go (and my fat *** always finishes a plate). That's just how much their servings are.  The banana pudding then comes around and the presentation was really nice. It was served on a Mason Jar with whipped cream on top with tiny butter cookies. It wasn't too sweet and kind of reminds me of bread pudding and was wondering whether the banana is mixed in the pudding or was it just the banana slices that were giving the taste. In my opinion it needed more banana slices. I just had way too much food to start off with so I wasn't able to finish the dessert.  Overall I would say I need a second trip to this place or maybe even a third. But it probably would not be on the top of my list if I have a hankering for Chicken and Waffles. The place has a nice ambience to it and almost feels like a fancy diner where you get to sip wine with your dinner and waffles or drink beer with your breakfast and of course waffles. Waffles, waffles, waffles haha.

He23ZX1tzFRfw_ulRtqDOw.text: Overall I would give this place 4 stars. Catfish is AWESOME. Chicken wasn't too bad. Koolaid was tooo sweet.   Service 3 stars: we had to wait about 15-20 mins to be acknowledge but Tasha was kind enough to notice and  step up to the plate and take our orders. a_PTsJLcLthGt8a0Xg68yA.text: So it's NOT Roscoe'a flavor. But the chicken is bigger than Roscoe's, greens are really good, service is GREAT, and they have a full bar full of great DRANKS (Blue Ivy alcoholic drink). wWj9jVuGsA0i2o49daHtrA.text: Today I happened to want something different than TC's Rib Crib. So I thought trying Lo Lo's Chicken & Waffles would be a nice Sunday treat to myself. I get here there were folk waiting outside to be seated not sure Why this was. There establishment is pretty spacious. But there were a number of dirty tables. I was told the wait was 15-20 minutes long. I said for one person as well? There was a Really pretty young adult girl that reminded me of my daughter. She was attentive and stepped in where the female that looked a tad bit older than she wasn't as efficient. I wish I knew her name, Every-time I asked her a question she took charge and handled it. No one knew the Guest WiFi, but this cutie pie did, when I asked Pee could she change the Television she was too busy. Again, this young adult assisted. It took her maybe 5-10 minutes to figure the remote control and the cable  boxes out, but she had patience also courteousness. She cleaned the bar area that was dirty with plates, to allow me access to be seated instantly. Her smile and presence were both bright. So I sit down, it took about 6-8 minutes before I was even noticed. The young adult girl did everything but served me my food and took my order. Pee was a Trainee not sure where Jose's badge was or Why he didn't have it on like the rest of the staff. I asked Pee for a number of things like salt & pepper shakers, more syrup etc. Didn't know she wasn't my server until she spouted this out to me. I guess good customer service weighs on a number of people. She told me that Jose was my Server. Basically letting me know like "Itch stop calling my name." This put a bad taste in my mouth, the Salmon Croquettes were very dry inside as if they were fried too hard and long. I wasn't aware that All there waffles came with cinnamon added in the batter. I thought this was like pancakes, you can request them how you like them. I never saw a GM or Manager that walks around in there restaurants just asking random customers random questions about there service or food this time around. Totally won't spend my money here, with piss poor hospitality. I've had nothing but Great service at other Soul Food spots. And other American restaurants and if there was a problem, you could bet it would be rectified. The way this female spouted out her words let's me know she's done and said anything out of her mouth to black people before this. I may just be the first to blast her on one of my yelp reviews. It's sad, I would've left a better tip hadn't my service with the bar attendants been so dissatisfying.

wln-5qZdg52VJMcf5y2ACg.text: I am currently at LoLo's with my family & the experience thus far is horrible! We waited 10 mins at the front to just get seated because no hostess was present. 7npjtN32yWTdaICz_c_CIQ.text: Worst dining experience ever. Sat at the bar since I was dining alone, first mistake, and that part of this experience itself should have told me to leave. After waiting 15 minutes to just get acknowledged by "blaze" the bartender I was able to place my whole order being that I hijacked a menu and had enough time to decide what I wanted....tick tock roughly 15 minutes passes..food started emerging from the kitchen for everyone around me. Some of them were there when I got there, so that means they had been waiting on food for at least 30 minutes. Tick tock, another 10mins pass, and a gentleman that came in well after me got his order. After that, blaze, advises me that she forgot to put my order in, and proceeds to putting it in. And I thought, surely it will be out quickly, because when servers make mistakes on orders they are resolved ahead of the other orders....why did I think that, because 15 more minutes pass, and blaze looks at me surprised not to see any food before me. I am livid and not even talking, so she proceeded to go get what I assume was the line chef to come out and tell me my food was behind 2 other tables orders. When I protested and plead my case that I have been waiting an hour she played the asshole role and asked me "do I want my food or not"? Where do they do that kind of customer service at? Lo-Lo's Chicken and waffles in Las Vegas, that's where... I wish I could tell you something about the food, but guess what, I never got it. I sat for another 10 mins to speak to the manager I requested, and ultimately took my hungry ass down the street to another dining experience.  I'll never get my time back, but I learned something, and I'll never make this mistake again.  (Lesson: If the service starts off bad, more than likely that's going to be the total experience. Just leave next time.)

eIQy7rXmG0RVkw-1z0EwWA.text: I've been following your IG for quite sometime and since I am currently in the Las Vegas area I thought I would it a try. First off Bree Bree the bartender/waitress super sweet. She made a GREAT Bloody Mary drink. I ordered food to go. I ordered a Sheeda's special and fried pickles. Like I said drink was great and Bree Bree told me take my time paying but personally I just like I get the bill out of the way. Okay food ordered and drink on board. Bill paid. So this is where I slowly started becoming disappointed. I ordered my food at 1:30pm. I no longer had anyone come up to ask me if I wanted another drink, a refill on water. I seen multiple employees walking around and that pretty much it. It witnessed one of the employees refill his own side drink but never anyone else. Not one of them including Bree never came back to check up. The place was not very busy at all so I just can't quite understand the service issue. 20 minutes or so later I noticed a to go back sitting across the bar from me. Multiple employees passed right by it but not one checked to see who it was for. Including Bree . So I waited and waited. It sat there for at least 15 minutes. I finally got up and asked the front greeter to please check on my order. He noticed the bag right away asked what I had ordered and said well here it is. I stated to him that bag of food has been sitting there for quite sometime. He said I'm sorry but here is your order with the condiments. I really had high expectations for this place and so disappointed. I leave and get back to my hotel and found no utensils or even napkins. Service needs ALOT of work. Food was really good but cold. I hope this review helps improve your employees attentiveness and service. I highly doubt I will be back soon. My first and last time unfortunately.

IowxtJGKQgc0aMjIKPGH9g.text: attempted to order take out yesterday. 7 calls later still no answer. So I head on over. To their defense they were crowded but over the span of 25 minutes no one answers except the answering machine?!? We head in. One lady was at the hostess counter and a few outside waiting to be seated. 7 minutes before a waitress finally came over and asked if we were waited on. The one lady said yes she was waiting for take out n we said we wanted to order. She took our order. I ordered a #1 no eggs and a #3. We leave and come back. Waited another 4 minutes or so and they asked to help us. Get our food, head home. Open the bag and NO GRITS!! Im livid. Called 4x no answer. dsMKshfuUppOU6hw-zxKXg.text: On our way to Laughlin, and since we were going through Vegas I had to stop here.  One of my favorite places to eat.  The weather was beautiful, so we sat outside this time. Seats are comfy and tables roomy, fyi.  I ordered the Tre-Tre (waffle plus two fried chicken legs) and my husband ordered the Lil Amadi (waffle plus two fried chicken thighs). I also got a side of fried okra.  First off--the friend okra. It was pretty darn good, second only to my mom's. I prefer my friend okra sliced slightly thinner and a little more cornmeal to the batter. But it was still really, really good & I'd order it again.  The waffles were just as delicious as I remember...some magical batter with cinnamon and other spices combined with butter and syrup makes them SO good.  And the fried chicken is perfect...crisp and juicy, not too thick of batter.    This time I tried their Lo-Lo's brand hot sauce and was surprised to find I really liked it.  I usually don't like the restaurant brand hot sauce because they're usually too smoky for my tastes.  This one was spicy and tangy, no smoke flavor. I'd actually consider buying it to take home if we weren't headed in the opposite direction!   The water still comes in a Mason jar, which works great for me since I drink a lot. Waitress was fine. Nice smile and friendly.  Gave us the right amount of time between drinks and ordering to look over the menu.  Can't wait to come back in May!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mother&#39;s Day breakfast...yum!!!
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Water in Mason jars
Photo of Lo-Lo's Chicken and Waffles - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tre-Tre (left), Lil Amadi (back), fried okra (right)

0dciDh7UlDpsqiJhelSsaw.text: Lolo's is one of those places I like. No...that's not right. I actually love this place I just wish they'd get their act together.  The food is amazing. It's authentic. It's delicious. The portions are big. Their house hot sauce is the right amount of spicy. Their mac and cheese is gooey and cheesy and creamy. And their banana pudding is to die for. Even things as simple as kool-aid somehow taste better here.  The service is great. The servers are all pleasant, cheery and down to earth. The bartenders are nice and the hostesses have always been sweet.  The problem? That it can take time for you to get service. We've actually went one time when apparently a special event they were hosting was taking up so much of their manpower that the hostess apologized and said we could sit at the bar until they had a table for us. After over 45min we decided it wasn't worth it. The staff was gracious enough to comp my beer and my girlfriends diet coke but wasting so much time still sucked.   They should have just closed up and opened up solely for their VIP event if they couldn't gather enough personnel to man that event and their regular restaurant crowd.   This seems to be a recurring issue with Lolo's because many reviewers say the same thing about slow or non existant service.   Luckily for me this has been an exception and not a rule. And im willing to wait a little for some amazing food. But other patrons might not be as patient.

H30kSwjR96cLm-7vnbZW2g.text: I had the TreTre with a side of Home Fries and it was the BOMB.COM!  My family and I went here for brunch when get got into town and the experience was OUTSTANDING. After all, we took up one side of the restaurant and had 2-3 waiters and they made sure we had EVERYTHING we needed and NOTHING came out wrong.   The menu has a plethora of delicious items to choose from, drinks, and even Kool-Aid on tap!   The fried chicken is perfectly seasoned with a very crispy skin and the waffles are savory until combined with the syrup. I believe you can choose between whole grain waffles and regular waffles--either way, they are both delicious.   Music is hip-hop/r&b and the vibe of the entire restaurant is just real chill. The servers and staff are also very friendly and helpful and will make sure you have an amazing time and that you're well taken care of!

OG0FZByszd4FDALJBJLw1w.text: Delicious food and it's legit. Please, people, don't compare it to Roscoes... and please don't say "I'm from LA and I know Chicken and Waffles". Roscoe is Roscoe and Lo-Lo's is Lo-Lo's... don't compare.   It's located 15 -20 minutes outside Vegas, in a big shopping plaza, on the Best Buy side, next to a McDonald's and Sweet Tomatoes restaurant.   We went on a Saturday around 1:00, used Yelp to join the waitlist and upon arrival, we were seated immediately. The place is noisy and family oriented. Very animated.  Our server was great!! Very attentive and said they had an ownership change and pretty much every staff was new. She said food was made to order, and there was 7 parties ahead of us. No worries I had my phone and a huge jar of sweet tea...  I wish they had biscuits or cornbread to snack on, as it was a good wait. Worth it though and my food was delicious. Chicken was crispy and moist. My candied yams was sweet and not mushy.   They ran out of grits and offered to sub for something else.. so I got Mac and cheese. Delicious!! However upon leaving I spied a table that had grits. Therefore one less star. They could have asked if I was willing to wait, if they were making more.   Stephen had the fried fish and he enjoyed it with the collard greens and waffle.  With 2 teas, lunch was $40. Worth the wait and the drive.

Qehv_U-lnQEAI5i98XAfHg.text: Great, great soul food AND service!! Now, the wait to receive our food was about 30 minutes or more, however it was well worth the wait. I would suggest that you expect to wait 30 minutes or more for your food, that way you're not disappointed or offended when/if it happens. We LOVE the food and service, so the wait time for our food doesn't bother us when we visit this spot.

B1F7Lit1IoYgXFuBFgwuRw.text: Bring a good book to read or 3 weeks of your unopened mail to read AND be prepared to W.....A....I....T... your a** off.   I can in on Monday afternoon at 2:00 pm 5/27/19 and was told there is a 90 minutes wait to be seated and additional time for someone to take your order.   I was baffled because 2/3 of the tables were unoccupied. So I asked how long it will take to get my food if I place a take away order. The lady at the desk says it be about 45 minutes. I decided to leave.   As I am still craving fried chicken & waffles; I called the restaurant at 6:30 PM on the same day and asked if I could place a phone order. I was told they are not taking phone orders. So I drove from Summerlin to the restaurant to place my order.   Upon arrival at 7:00 PM, I was told it will be 15 minutes before they can take my take away order and I was told to sit in the foyer and wait for the lady at the cashiers desk to call me.   It is now 7:30 PM , I am currently sitting in the foyer and will continue writing this review after my food is ready (hopefully my food will be ready before midnight).  So, my food was ready at 7:34 PM. I ate in my car and I must say it was actually good. I am not having an orgasm or anything like that but the chicken and waffles we better than average. My meal cost $16.99 and contained 2 legs, 1 thigh and 2 waffles.   In my opinion, the staff need major customer service training and they also need some attitude adjustment. My observation conclude that they are not customer friendly. So if you go be there be prepared to receiving major shade from the staff.  Unfortunately, because of the customer service or lack of customer service and the excessive wait time Ihave to give them 2 1/2 stars. If the get there act tougher they can easily get 4 stars from me because the food was good.

fOPRHE1fxbGOWGeBNgqGTg.text: Loved the soul food here.  Servers were great too.  Had to wait a bit because was crowded.  Was worth the wait.  Next time in Las Vegas will be back.  Wish they had one in Los Angeles.

bJtSWwg5erVpbtl1j-0Kgg.text: I really hate that this place just can't seem to get it together time and time again. This used to be my go to restaurant anytime I was in town and for a few months it was consistently good, however over the course of the last year it's gone drastically downhill. From the poor service (literally takes 15-20 mins just for someone to acknowledge you once you've sit down), to the temperature of the food that comes out (straight cold, not even Luke warm). The last 2 times I visited I though maybe they were just having an off day since it was a Saturday afternoon so I went back again to order the same thing on Tuesday (huge mistake and waste of time and money). When I brought up the fact that my food was cold to my server I was met with "well it was hot when it came out the kitchen"...seriously that's your response after I just waited almost 45 mins for a completely cold entree ?!? Safe to say I'm officially done with this place and will no longer be giving them anothe chance.
